p: Since it is a common source of selection bias, a point of weakness in all the studies is the lack of description of the methods adopted to generate random allocation sequences [ 78] ( Table 6). Moreover, all the studies were poor in number of subjects recruited. In four of them, the sample of people recruited did not exceed 50 patients, in four studies, the samples exceeded 50 participants, and only in one study the sample was more than 100 patients (Tables 2 and 3).
